(1, 1, 1): Standardised test. Available in 2 modules: "Academic", "General training". The IELTS test partners also offer IELTS Life Skills, a speaking and listening test used for UK Visas and Immigration.
(2, 1, 1): British Council, IDP Education, Cambridge Assessment English.
(3, 1, 1): Listening, reading, writing and speaking of the English language.
(4, 1, 1): To assess the English language proficiency of non-native English speakers.
(6, 1, 1): Listening: 40 minutes (including the 10-minute transfer time), ,  Reading: 60 minutes, ,  Writing: 60 minutes, ,  Speaking: 11–14 minutes. ,  Total: 2 hours, 55 minutes.
(9, 1, 1): Up to 4 times a month. Up to 48 times a year.
(10, 1, 1): More than 1,200 test centres in over 140 countries
(12, 1, 1): No official prerequisite. Intended for non-native English speakers.
(13, 1, 1): To find out the test fee in local currency, use the IELTS Worldwide search to identify a local centre.
(14, 1, 1): More than 10,000 colleges, agencies and other institutions in over 140 countries
